articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. accuses Russia, China of blocking U.N. statement on Baghdad embassy attack
articles.description: The United States accused Russia and China on Monday of blocking a United Nations Security Council statement "underscoring the inviolability of diplomatic and consular premises" after a Dec. 31 attack on the U.S. embassy in Baghdad.
articles.content: UNITED NATIONS (Reuters) - The United States accused Russia and China on Monday of blocking a United Nations Security Council statement “underscoring the inviolability of diplomatic and consular premises” after a Dec. 31 attack on the U.S. embassy in Baghdad.… [+407 chars]

articles.title: Russia says election of new parliament leader in Venezuela was democratic
articles.description: Russian Foreign Ministry said on Monday the election of a new parliament leader in Venezuela was a result of a democratic procedure.
articles.content:
MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian Foreign Ministry said on Monday the election of a new parliament leader in Venezuela was a result of a democratic procedure.

articles.author: Steven Scheer
articles.title: Israel worried over tourism growth after reaching record 4.55 million in 2019
articles.description: Israel received a record number of tourist visits in 2019 but growth could be slowed this year due to cuts in spending on advertising to promote the country as a destination, the tourism ministry said on Monday.
articles.content:
JERUSALEM (Reuters) - Israel received a record number of tourist visits in 2019 but growth could be slowed this year due to cuts in spending on advertising to promote the country as a destination, the tourism ministry said on Monday.

articles.title: Iran's Soleimani killing has rapidly escalated Gulf event risks: S&P Global
articles.description: Bahrain, Qatar and Oman's sovereign ratings would be the most vulnerable to a protracted and wider conflict in the Gulf region following the killing of Iran's top military commander Qassem Soleimani, S&P Global said on Monday.

LONDON (Reuters) - Bahrain, Qatar and Oman’s sovereign ratings would be the most vulnerable to a protracted and wider conflict in the Gulf region following the killing of Iran’s top military commander Qassem Soleimani, S&P Global said on Monday.

articles.title: UNESCO says U.S. signed treaties not to harm cultural heritage
articles.description: UNESCO said on Monday that the United States has signed treaties committing it not to harm cultural heritage in the event of armed conflict.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Weinstein, using walker, arrives in court
articles.description: Former movie mogul Harvey Weinstein arrived in a Manhattan court on Monday where he faces a rape trial. The barrage of accusations he faced helped launch the #MeToo movement and became a reckoning for powerful men accused of sexual misconduct.
articles.content:
Posted 
Former movie mogul Harvey Weinstein arrived in a Manhattan court on Monday where he faces a rape trial. The barrage of accusations he faced helped launch the #MeToo movement and became a reckoning for powerful men accused of sexual misconduct.
